input: Last video I left you with a puzzle.
from_community_srt: U prošlom snimku ostavio sam vas sa zagonetkom.

input: The setup involves two sliding blocks in a perfectly idealized world where there's no friction and all collisions are perfectly elastic, meaning no energy is lost.
from_community_srt: Postavka uključuje dva bloka koji se klizaju u savršeno idealizovanom svetu gde nema trenja i svi sudari su savršeno elastični što znači da nema gubitaka energije.

input: One block is sent towards another smaller one, which starts off stationary and there's a wall behind it, so that the smaller block bounces back and forth until it redirects the big block's momentum enough to fully turn around, sailing away from the wall.
from_community_srt: Jedan blok šaljemo prema drugom, manjem, koji je u stanju mirovanja, i postoji zid iza njega, tako da se manji blok odbija napred-nazad sve dok ne promeni momenat sile većeg bloka dovoljno da se ovaj brže udalji od zida nego manji.

input: If that first block has a mass which is a power of 100 times the mass of the second, for example a million times as much, an insanely surprising fact popped out.
from_community_srt: Ako taj prvi blok ima masu koja je jednaka masi drugog pomnoženoj sa nekim stepenom broja 100, na primer 1.000.000 puta veću, suludo iznenađujuća činjenica se pojavi:

input: The total number of collisions, including those between the second mass and the wall, has the same starting digits as pi.
from_community_srt: Ukupan broj sudara, računajući one između blokova kao i one između manjeg bloka i zida, ima iste početne cifre kao π.

input: In this example that's 3141 collisions.
from_community_srt: U ovom primeru to je 3.141 sudar.

input: If that first block was a trillion times the mass, it would be 3,141,592 collisions before this happens.
from_community_srt: Ako bi prvi blok bio bilion (10^12) puta veće mase, bilo bi potrebno 3.141.592 sudara pre nego što se ovo desi,

input: Almost all of which happen in one huge unrealistic burst.
from_community_srt: od kojih bi se većina desila u jednom ogromnom prasku.

input: And speaking of unexpectedly big bursts, in the short time since that video went out, lots of people have been sharing solutions and attempts and simulations, which is awesome.
from_community_srt: Govoreći o neočekivanim praskovima (izlivima), u kratkom periodu od kada je taj video izašao mnogo ljudi je delilo rešenja, pokušaje i simulacije što je... strava!

input: So why does this happen?
from_community_srt: (linkovi ka 2 omiljena su u opisu) Dakle, zašto se ovo dešava?

input: Why should pi show up in such an unexpected place and in such an unexpected manner?
from_community_srt: Zbog čega bi se π pojavio na tako neočekivanom mestu i na tako neočekivan način? Prvenstveno,

input: Foremost this is a lesson about using phase space, also commonly called configuration space, to solve problems.
from_community_srt: ovo je lekcija o korišćenju faznog prostora, takođe uobičajeno nazivanog konfiguracioni prostor, za rešavanje problema.

input: So rest assured that you're not just learning about some esoteric algorithm for pi, this tactic here is core to many other fields, and is a useful tool to keep in your belt.
from_community_srt: Dakle, budite uvereni da ne učite samo o nekakvom ezoteričnom algoritmu za π, ova ovde taktika je jezgro mnogih drugih oblasti. Ona je korisna alatka za posedovati.

input: To start, when one block hits another, how do you figure out the velocity of each one after the collision?
from_community_srt: Za početak, kada jedan blok udari drugi,

input: The key is to use the conservation of energy together with the conservation of momentum.
from_community_srt: kako saznati brzinu kojom se oba kreću posle sudara? Ključno je koristiti zakon očuvanja energije zajedno sa zakonom očuvanja momenta sile.

input: Let's call their masses m1 and m2, and their velocities v1 and v2, which will be the variables changing throughout the process.
from_community_srt: Hajde da obeležimo njihove mase sa m1 i m2, a njihove brzine kretanja sa v1 i v2 koje će biti promenljive veličine tokom procesa.

input: At any given point, the total kinetic energy is ½ m1 v1² plus ½ m2 v2².
from_community_srt: U svakom datom trenutku, ukupna kinetička energija iznosi:

input: So even though v1 and v2 will be changing as the blocks get bumped around, the value of this expression must remain constant.
from_community_srt: (½)m1(v1)^2 + (½)m2(v2)^2 Iako će se vrednosti za v1 i v2 menjati kako se blokovi odbijaju, vrednost izraza mora ostati nepromenjena.

input: The total momentum of the two blocks is m1v1 plus m2v2.
from_community_srt: Ukupan momenat sile ova dva bloka iznosi: m1*v1 + m2*v2.

input: This also has to remain constant when the blocks hit each other, but it can change as the second block bounces off the wall.
from_community_srt: Ova vrednost takođe ostaje nepromenjena kada blokovi udaraju jedan u drugog, ali može se menjati kada se drugi blok odbije od zid.

input: In reality, the second block would transfer its momentum to the wall during this collision, and again we're being idealistic, say thinking of that wall as having infinite mass, so such a momentum transfer won't actually move the wall.
from_community_srt: U stvarnosti, drugi blok bi preneo svoj momenat sile na zid tokom ovog sudara Ponavljam, ovo je idealističan slučaj, pa zamislimo da zid ima beskonačnu masu, te takav prenos momenta sile zapravo neće pomeriti zid.

input: So here we have two equations and two unknowns.
from_community_srt: Dakle, ovde imamo dve jednačine i dve nepoznate.

input: To put these to use, try drawing a picture to represent the equations.
from_community_srt: Da bi nam bile korisne, hajde da nacrtamo sliku kako bi predstavili jednačine.

input: You might start by focusing on the energy equation.
from_community_srt: Mogli bi početi tako što ćemo se usredsrediti na jednačinu energije.

input: Since v1 and v2 are changing, maybe you think to represent the equation on a coordinate plane where x is equal to v1 and y is equal to v2.
from_community_srt: Pošto se v1 i v2 menjaju, možda smislite da predstavite jednačinu  u koordinatnom sistemu, gde x-osa predstavlja v1 a y-osa predstavlja v2.

input: So individual points on this plane encode the pair of velocities of our block.
from_community_srt: Tako pojedinačne tačke na ovoj ravni predstavljaju brzine kretanja naših blokova u tim tačkama.

input: In that case, the energy equation represents an ellipse, where each point of this ellipse gives you a pair of velocities, all of which correspond to the same total kinetic energy.
from_community_srt: U tom slučaju jednačina energije predstavlja elipsu, gde svaka tačka na elipsi predstavlja brzine dva bloka, i svaka odgovara istoj ukupnoj kinetičkoj energiji U stvari,

input: In fact, let's change our coordinates a little bit to make this a perfect circle, since we know we're on a hunt for pi.
from_community_srt: hajde da zapravo malo promenimo koordinate da bi dobili savšen krug.

input: Instead of having the x-coordinate represent v1, let it be the square root of m1 times v1, which for this example stretches the figure in the x-direction by the square root of 10.
from_community_srt: Pošto znamo da smo u lovu na π, umesto da x-osa predstavlja v1, neka predstavlja kv.koren(m1)*v1 što za prikazani primer rasteže naš oblik u x-smeru za kv.koren(10)

input: Likewise, have the y-coordinate represent square root of m2 times v2.
from_community_srt: Isto tako, neka y-osa predstavlja kv. koren(m2)*v2.

input: That way, when you look at the conservation of energy equation, what it's saying is ½ x2 plus y2 equals some constant, which is the equation for a circle, which specific circle depends on the total energy, but that doesn't matter for our problem.
from_community_srt: Na taj način, kada pogledate ovu jednačinu za očuvanje energije, ono što ona govori jeste da je izraz  ½(x^2 + y^2) jednak nekoj konstanti. Što je jednačina kruga! Kog određenog kruga, zavisi od ukupne energije, ali to zapravo nije važno za naš problem.

input: At the beginning, when the first block is sliding to the left and the second one is stationary, we're at the leftmost point on the circle, where the x-coordinate is negative and the y-coordinate is zero.
from_community_srt: Na početku, kada se prvi blok kliza nalevo a drugi je nepomičan, nalazimo se na krajnjoj levoj tački kruga, gde je vrednost na x-osi negativna a na y-osi jednaka nuli.

input: What about right after the collision?
from_community_srt: A posle sudara,

input: How do we know what happens?
Conservation of energy tells us that we must jump to some other point of the circle, but which one?
from_community_srt: kako da znamo šta se dešava? Očuvanje energije nam govori da moramo preći na neku drugu tačku na krugu,

input: Use the conservation of momentum.
from_community_srt: ali koju? Pa, koristite očuvanje momenta sile!

input: This tells us that before and after the collision, the value of m1 times v1 plus m2 times v2 must stay constant.
from_community_srt: On nam govori da pre i posle sudara vrednost m1*v1 + m2*v2 mora ostati nepromenjena.

input: In our rescaled coordinates, that looks like saying square root of m1 times x plus square root of m2 times y equals some constant.
from_community_srt: U našim koordinatama prilagođenih razmera to izgleda poput: kv.kor(m1)*x + kv.kor(m2)*y = (konstanta).

input: And that's the equation for a line, specifically a line with a slope of negative square root of m1 over m2.
from_community_srt: A to je jednačina linije. Konkretno, linije sa nagibom koji iznosi : - kv.koren(m1/m2).

input: You might ask which specific line, and that depends on what the constant momentum is, but we know that it must pass through our first point, and that locks us into one choice.
from_community_srt: Možda ćete se zapitati koja konkretna linija, i to zavisi od toga koliko iznosi nepromenjeni momenat sile. Ali znamo da ta linija mora proći kroz našu prvu tačku, i to nam daje samo jedan izbor.

input: So just to be clear about what all this is saying, all other pairs of velocities which would give the same momentum live on this line, in just the same way that all other pairs of velocities that give the same energy live on this circle.
from_community_srt: Da razjasnimo šta nam sve ovo govori: Svi drugi parovi brzina koji bi dali isti momenat sile "žive" na ovoj liniji, na isti način na koji svi drugi parovi brzina koji daju istu energiju "žive" na ovom krugu.

input: So notice, this gives us one and only one other point that we could jump to.
from_community_srt: Primetite, ovo nam daje jednu, i samo jednu tačku na koju možemo preći.

input: And it should make sense that it's something where the x-coordinate gets a little less negative and the y-coordinate becomes negative, since that corresponds to the big block, which is slowing down a little, while the little block zooms off towards the wall.
from_community_srt: I trebalo bi da ima smisla da je ta tačka negde gde je vrednost x- ose malo manje negativna, a vrednost y-ose postaje negativna, jer to odgovara malom usporavanju velikog bloka, dok se mali blok zaleće prema zidu.

input: From here it's quite fun to see how things play out.
from_community_srt: Odavde je veoma zanimljivo videti kako se stvari odigravaju! Kada se drugi blok odbije od zid,

input: When the second block bounces off the wall, its speed stays the same, but it goes from negative to positive, right?
from_community_srt: njegova brzina ostane ista, ali se promeni od negativne ka pozitivnoj.

input: So in this diagram, that corresponds to reflecting about the x-axis, since the y-coordinate gets multiplied by negative 1.
from_community_srt: Zar ne? Na ovom dijagramu, to odgovara preslikavanju u odnosu na x-osu, jer se vrednost y-ose množi sa -1.

input: Then once more, the next collision corresponds to a jump along a line with slope negative square root of m1 over m2, since staying on such a line is what conservation of momentum looks like in this diagram.
from_community_srt: Zatim, još jednom, sledeći sudar odgovara skoku duž linije čiji je nagib: - kv.koren(m1/m2), pošto ostanak na takvoj liniji prikazuje kako očuvanje momenta sile izgleda na ovom dijagramu.

input: And from here you can fill in the rest for how the block collisions correspond to hopping around the circle in our picture, where we keep going like this, until the velocity of that smaller block is both positive and smaller than the velocity of the big one, meaning they'll never touch again.
from_community_srt: Odavde možete da popunite ostatak, jer sudari blokova odgovaraju pomeranju unutar kruga na našoj slici. Nastavićemo tako sve dok brzina manjeg bloka ne bude pozitivna i manja od brzine velikog bloka, što znači da se više neće sresti.

input: That corresponds to this triangular region in the upper right of the diagram, so in our region.
from_community_srt: To odgovara području trougla u gornjem desnom delu dijagrama, tako da ćemo se pomerati unutar kruga dok se ne nađemo u tom području.

input: What we've drawn here is called a phase diagram, which is a simple but powerful idea in math where you encode the state of some system, in this case the velocities of our sliding blocks, as a single point in some abstract space.
from_community_srt: Ovde smo nacrtali takozvani "fazni dijagram", koji je jednostavna ali moćna ideja u matematici kojom prikazujemo svojstva nekog sistema, u ovom slučaju brzine kližućih blokova, kao tačke u nekom zamišljenom prostoru.

input: What's powerful here is that it turns questions about dynamics into questions about geometry.
from_community_srt: Ideja je moćna jer probleme dinamike pretvara u probleme geometrije.

input: In this case, the dynamical idea of all possible pairs of velocities that conserve energy corresponds to the geometric idea of a circle, and counting the total number of collisions turns into counting the total number of hops along these lines, alternating between vertical and diagonal.
from_community_srt: U ovom slučaju, dinamička predstava svih mogućih parova brzina sa očuvanjem energije odgovara geometrijskoj predstavi kruga na dijagramu, pa prebrojavanje svih sudara postaje prebrojavanje svih skokova duž ovih linija, naizmenično vertikalnih i dijagonalnih.

input: But our question remains, why is it that when that mass ratio is a power of 100, the total number of steps shows the digits of pi?
from_community_srt: Ali ostaje pitanje: kada je razmera mase jednaka stepenu broja 100, zašto je broj koraka izražen ciframa broja π?

input: Well, if you stare at this picture, maybe, just maybe, you'd notice that all the arc lengths between the points on this circle seem to be about the same.
from_community_srt: Ako pažljivo pogledate sliku, možda primetite da svi kružni isečci između tačaka na krugu izgledaju isto.

input: It's not immediately obvious that this should be true, but if it is, it means that computing the value of one such arc length should be enough to figure out how many total collisions it takes to get us into that end zone.
from_community_srt: Na prvi pogled nije uočljivo da oni moraju biti isti, ali ako jesu, onda nam je dovoljno da izračunamo vrednost jednog kružnog isečka kako bi saznali koliko je sudara potrebno da stignemo do označene  tj.

input: The key here is to use the ever-helpful inscribed angle theorem, which says that whenever you're forming an angle using three points on a circle, P1, P2, and P3, like this, it will be exactly half of the angle formed by P1, the circle's center, and P3.
from_community_srt: krajnje zone Ovde je ključno koristiti uvek korisnu teoremu upisanog ugla, koja kaže da svaki put kada formiramo ugao koristeći 3 tačke na krugu - P1, P2 i P3, on će biti upola manji od ugla koji formiraju tačke P1, centar kruga i P3.

input: P2 can be anywhere on this circle, anywhere except between P1 and P3, and this lovely little fact will be true.
from_community_srt: P2 može biti bilo gde na krugu, osim između tačaka P1 i P3, i ova teorema će važiti.

input: So now look back at our phase space, and focus specifically on three points, like these.
from_community_srt: Pogledajmo sada naš fazni prostor, i usredsredimo se na baš takve 3 tačke.

input: Remember that first vertical hop corresponds to the second block bouncing off the wall, and that second hop, along a slope of negative square root of m1 over m2, corresponds to a momentum-conserving block collision.
from_community_srt: Podsetimo se, prvi uspravan skok odgovara odbijanju malog bloka od zid, a potom spust niz nagib koji je jednak: -kv.kor.(m1/m2) odgovara sudaru blokova pri kojem je očuvan momenat sile.

input: Let's call the angle between this momentum line and the vertical line theta, and now maybe you see it using the inscribed angle theorem, this arc length between those two bottom points, measured in radians, will be 2 theta.
from_community_srt: Ugao koji zaklapaju linija pod nagibom i uspravna linija nazovimo "Θ". Sada vidite koristeći teoremu upisanog ugla da kružni isečak između dve donje tačke izražen u radijanima iznosi 2*Θ.

input: And importantly, since the momentum line has the same slope for all of those jumps from the top of the circle to the bottom, the same reasoning means that all of these arc lengths must also be 2 theta.
from_community_srt: Ovo je važno - pošto linija momenta sile ima isti nagib za svaki spust od vrha kruga na dole to znači da svi ovi kružni isečci moraju iznositi 2*Θ.

input: So for each hop, if we drop down a new arc, like so, then after each collision we cover another 2 theta radians of the circle.
from_community_srt: Ako spustimo novi kružni isečak za svaki skok, ovako, onda posle svakog sudara pokrijemo još 2*Θ radijana na krugu.

input: We stop once we're in the end zone on the right, which remember corresponds to both blocks moving to the right with the smaller one going slower.
from_community_srt: Zaustavićemo se kada dospemo u označenu zonu sa desne strane što odgovara slučaju kada oba bloka idu nadesno i pritom manji ide sporije.

input: But you can also think of this as stopping at the point when adding one more arc of 2 theta would overlap with the previous one.
from_community_srt: Možemo zamisliti ovo tako što se zaustavljamo u tački gde bi se dodavanje još jednog isečka od 2*Θ preklopilo sa prethodnim.

input: In other words, how many times do you have to add 2 theta to itself before it covers more than the whole circle, more than 2 pi radians?
from_community_srt: Drugim rečima, koliko puta treba dodati 2*Θ samom sebi pre nego što pokrije više od punog kruga,

input: The answer to this will be the same as the number of collisions between our blocks.
from_community_srt: više od 2*π radijana? Odgovor je isti kao i broj sudara između blokova.

input: Or to say the same thing more compactly, what's the largest integer multiple of theta that doesn't surpass pi?
from_community_srt: Ili, sažeto rečeno koji je najveći ceo broj kojim možemo pomnožiti Θ a da ne premašimo π? Na primer,

input: For example, if theta was 0.01 radians, then multiplying it by as much as 314 would keep you below pi, but multiplying by 315 would bring you over that value.
from_community_srt: ako je Θ = 0,01 radijana onda bi množenje sa 314 dalo rezultat ispod π, ali bi množenje sa 315 dalo rezultat iznad te vrednosti.

input: So the answer would be 314, meaning if our mass ratio was one such that the angle theta in our diagram was 0.01, then the blocks would collide 314 times.
from_community_srt: Dakle rezultat bi bio 314, što znači da ako bi odnos mase bio takav da ugao Θ na našem dijagramu bude 0,01 blokovi bi se sudarili 314 puta.

input: So now you know what we need to do.
from_community_srt: Sada znate šta treba da uradimo,

input: Let's go ahead and actually compute the value theta, say when the mass ratio is 100 to 1.
from_community_srt: hajde da zaista izračunamo vrednost Θ recimo kada je odnos mase 100:1 Setimo se,

input: Remember, this rise over run slope of that constant momentum line was the negative square root of m1 over m2, which in this example is negative 10.
from_community_srt: ovaj nagib (Δy/Δx) linije konstantnog momenta sile računali smo kao: -kv.koren(m1/m2), što je u ovom slučaju -10.

input: That would mean that the tangent of this angle theta, opposite over adjacent, is the run over the negative rise, so to speak, which is 1 divided by 10 in this example.
from_community_srt: To bi značilo da je tangens ugla Θ (naspramna kroz naleglu katetu) jednak Δx/-Δy, takoreći, što iznosi 1/10 u ovom primeru.

input: So theta is going to be the arctan of 1 tenth.
Speaking more generally, it'll be the inverse tangent of the square root of the small mass over the square root of the big mass.
from_community_srt: Dakle Θ će biti = arctg (1/10) Uopšteno uzevši, Θ će biti arkus tangens kvadratnog korena male mase podeljenog sa kvadratnim korenom velike mase.

input: If you plug these into a calculator, what you'd notice is that the inverse tangent of such a small value is actually quite close to the value itself.
from_community_srt: Ako unesete ove vrednosti u digitron, primetićete da je arkus tangens tako male vrednosti zapravo prilično blizu samoj vrednosti Na primer,

input: For example, arctan of 1 over 100, corresponding to a big mass of 10,000 kg, is extremely close to 0.01.
from_community_srt: arctg (1/100) koji odgovara velikoj masi od 10.000 kg, je veoma blizu 0,01.

input: In fact, it's so close that for the sake of our central question, it might as well be 0.01.
from_community_srt: Zapravo, toliko je blizu da za svrhu našeg centralnog pitanja, kao da i jeste 0,01.

input: What I mean by that is, analogous to what we saw a moment ago, adding this to itself as many as 314 times won't surpass pi, but the 315th time would.
from_community_srt: Ono što pod tim podrazumevam je, analogno onom što smo videli pre par trenutaka, da dodavanje ove vrednosti 314 puta neće premašiti π, ali 315 put hoće.

input: Remember, unraveling why we're doing all this, that's a way of counting how many jumps on the phase diagram gets us into the end zone, which in turn is a way of counting how many times the blocks collide until they're sailing off to never touch again.
from_community_srt: Setimo se, otkrivajući zašto ovo radimo, to je način da prebrojimo koliko skokova na faznom dijagramu nas dovodi u krajnju zonu što je, sledstveno, način da prebrojimo koliko puta se blokovi sudare pre nego što "odjedre" i više se ne dodirnu.

input: So that, my friends, is why a mass ratio of 10,000 gives 314 collisions.
from_community_srt: Dakle zbog toga, moji prijatelji, odnos mase od 10.000 :1 rezultira sa 314 sudara.

input: Likewise, a mass ratio of a million to one will give an angle theta equals the inverse tangent of 1 over 1000.
from_community_srt: Isto tako, odnos mase od 1.000.000 : 1 imaće ugao Θ = arctg (1/1.000).

input: This is extremely close to 0.001.
And again, if we ask about the largest integer multiple of this angle that doesn't surpass pi, it's the same as it would be for a precise value of 0.001, namely 3141.
from_community_srt: Ovo je izuzetno blizu vrednosti 0,001 i ako se ponovo zapitamo koji je najveći ceo broj kojim možemo pomnožiti Θ, a da ne premašimo π odgovor je isti kao kada bi računali sa tačno 0,001 naime - 3.141 Ovo su prve četiri cifre π jer to je,

input: These are the first four digits of pi because that is, by definition, what digits of a number mean.
from_community_srt: po definiciji,

input: This explains why when the mass ratio is a million, the number of collisions is 3141.
from_community_srt: šta cifre nekog broja predstavljaju Ovo objašnjava zašto u slučaju kada je odnos mase 1.000.000 : 1,

input: And you might notice that all of this relies on the hope that the inverse tangent of a small value is sufficiently close to the value itself, which is another way of saying that the tangent of a small value is approximately that value itself.
from_community_srt: broj sudara bude 3.141 Možda primećujete da sve ovo počiva na nadi da je arkus tangens male vrednosti dovoljno blizu samoj vrednosti Što je drugi način da kažemo da je tangens male vrednosti približan samoj vrednosti.

input: Intuitively, there's a really nice reason this is true.
from_community_srt: Intuitivno,

input: If you look at a unit circle, the tangent of any given angle is the height of this little triangle I've drawn divided by its width.
from_community_srt: postoji dobar razlog zašto je tako: Ako pogledate jedinični krug, tangens zadatog ugla predstavlja visinu trougla koji sam nacrtao podeljenu sa njegovom širinom.

input: And when that angle is really small, the width is basically 1, the radius of your circle, and the height is basically the same as the arc length along that circle, and by definition that arc length is theta.
from_community_srt: Kada je taj ugao zaista mali, širina je praktično 1 (poluprečnik kruga) a visina je praktično ista kao kružni isečak, koji je po definiciji upravo Θ.

input: To be more precise about it, the Taylor series expansion of tangent of theta shows that this approximation will have only a cubic error term.
from_community_srt: Da budemo precizniji, Tejlorov polinom za tan(Θ) pokazuje da će ova aproksimacija imati samo kubni ostatak.

input: So for example, the tangent of 1 one hundredth differs from 1 one hundredth itself by something on the order of 1 one millionth.
from_community_srt: Na primer, tan(1/100) razlikuje se od 1/100 za vrednost reda veličine od 1/1.000.000.

input: So even if we were to consider 314 steps with this angle, the error between the actual value of arc tan 1 over 100 and the approximation of 0.01 just won't have a chance to accumulate high enough to be as big as an integer.
from_community_srt: Čak iako bismo uzeli u obzir 314 koraka sa ovim uglom, ostatak između stvarne vrednosti arctg(1/100) i približne 0,01 neće moći da se nagomila dovoljno za ceo broj.

input: So let's zoom out and sum up.
from_community_srt: Hajde da umanjimo prikaz i rezimiramo:

input: When blocks collide, you can figure out their new velocities by slicing a line through a circle in a velocity phase diagram, where each of these curves represents a conservation law.
from_community_srt: Kada se blokovi sudare, možete izračunati njihove nove brzine pomoću linije koja preseca krug u faznom dijagramu brzine, gde svaka kriva predstavlja zakon očuvanja.

input: Most notably, the conservation of energy is what plants that circular seed that ultimately blossoms into the pi that we find in the final count.
from_community_srt: Najvažnije, očuvanje energije je ono što sadi kružno seme koje konačno procveta u π kojeg pronalazimo u konačnom zbiru.

input: Specifically, due to some inscribed angle geometry, the points that we hit of this circle are spaced out evenly, separated by an angle we were calling 2 theta.
from_community_srt: Osobito, usled geometrije upisanog ugla, tačke koje dodirujemo na ovom krugu jednako su raspoređene, razdvojene uglom koji nosi oznaku 2*Θ.

input: This lets us rephrase the question of counting collisions, as instead asking how many times must we add 2 theta to itself before it surpasses 2 pi.
from_community_srt: To nam omogućava da preformulišemo pitanje brojanja sudara i umesto toga se zapitamo koliko puta moramo sabrati 2*Θ pre nego što premašimo 2*π.

input: If theta looks something like 0.001, the answer to that question has the same first digits as pi, and when the mass ratio is some power of 100, because arc tan of x is so well approximated by x for small values, theta is sufficiently close to this value that it gives the same final count.
from_community_srt: Ako je Θ približno 0,001 odgovor na to pitanje je broj sa istim početnim ciframa kao π. A kada je odnos mase neki stepen broja 100, jer arctg(x) za male vrednosti ima približno istu vrednost kao x, Θ je dovoljno blizu ovoj vrednosti da dobijemo isti konačni zbir.

input: I'll emphasize again what this phase space allowed us to do, because as I said, this is a lesson useful for all sorts of math, like differential equations, chaos theory, and other flavors of dynamics.
from_community_srt: Naglasiću još jednom šta nam je ovaj fazni prostor omogućio, jer kao što sam rekao, ovo je lekcija korisna za razne oblasti matematike, kao diferencijalne jednačine,

input: By representing the relevant state of your system as a single point in an abstract space, it lets you translate problems of dynamics into problems of geometry.
from_community_srt: teoriju haosa i druge oblike dinamike: Predstavljajući odgovarajuće stanje sistema kao jednu tačku u zamišljenom prostoru možete da probleme dinamike tumačite kao geometrijske probleme.

input: I repeat myself because I don't want you to come away just remembering a neat puzzle where pi shows up unexpectedly, I want you to remember this surprise appearance as a distilled remnant of the deeper relationship at play.
from_community_srt: Ponavljam se jer ne želim da iz ovoga ponesete samo zgodnu zagonetku u kojoj se π neočekivano pojavljuje Želim da se sećate ovog neočekivanog pojavljivanja kao prečišćenog ostatka dubljeg odnosa na delu.

input: And if this solution leaves you feeling satisfied, it shouldn't, because there is another perspective, more clever and pretty than this one, due to Galperin and his original paper on this phenomenon, which invites us to draw a striking parallel between the dynamics of these blocks and that of a beam of light bouncing between two mirrors.
from_community_srt: Ako vas ovo rešenje zadovoljava, ne bi trebalo, jer postoji još jedan ugao posmatranja. Umešniji i lepši od ovog zahvaljujući Galperinovom originalnom radu na ovoj pojavi, koji nas poziva da povučemo neobičnu paralelu između dinamike ovih blokova i zraka svetlosti koji se odbija od dva ogledala.

input: Trust me, I've saved the best for last on this topic, so I hope to see you again in the next video.
from_community_srt: Verujte mi, najbolje sam sačuvao za kraj, tako da se nadam ponovnom viđanju u sledećem snimku.
